page.title: 18Local History
page.content: Over recent decades{industries}and {crafts}have declined in Repton. For example there used to be blacksmiths, cobblers, bakers, gas workers, carpenters and basket makers. Repton has very{old buildings}apart from those belonging to the school (see another block). There are two old houses over 400 years old. One of them was lived in by Bishop Abrams in Well Lane. Most of the houses in the main street were built between 1886 and 1903. The region has few connections with {royalty}except for recent visits of the Queen in 1952 and the Duchess of Kent in 1985 and a shooting trip which Prince Charles is said to have made. Newton Solbey has little of historic interest except for two marble effigies of crusaders.
